alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 2:58PM EDT until July 07 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTY... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, secondary roads, as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Willsboro, Elizabethtown, Keene, Minerva, Newcomb, Mount Marcy, Keene Valley, Jay In Essex County, Lewis, St. Huberts, Mount Van Hoevenberg, Mount Van Hoevenburg Recreation Area, Underwood, Tahawus, Upper Jay, New Russia, Vanderwhacker Mountain, North Jay, Deerhead and Reber. While rainfall has abated somewhat in the warning area over the past 90 minutes, additional heavier showers and storms may affect the warning area through late afternoon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
